intro: Marquartia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like hibiscus and cotton. Marquartia tomentosa is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
